intro: Mastersiella digitata, commonly known as the digitate mastersiella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, digitate (finger-like) leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
